body:
The mtime is the key on S3 the modification time is stored.

This error actually means that the file "key" that was being updated doesn't exist.

http://www.benhallbenhall.com/2013/01/amazon-s3-error-key-exist/

It probably means that the transfer of that file failed in some way earlier.

Retrying the sync should fix it

Thanks for the quick reply.  I'll keep an eye on it next copy.

I also notice that I get 408 request time-out's from Cloudfiles when performing checks.  Should I up the timeout (have it set at 2min), or do you think this is an issue with the Rackspace server?
The 408 comes from the server so upping the rclone timeout probably won't help. I have found that cloud files gets  very busy at times.

Ok.  Sorry to keep bugging you, but I also see a lot of this in the output and wondering if I should ignore it or be concerned that copies/checks are failing.  Did some looking around, but it's not clear to me what this actually indicates.

`Unsolicited response received on idle HTTP channel starting with "H"; err=<nil>`
That is exciting! Never seen that before. Can you post the whole log line with a few logs before and after?

Seems to happen after every check...

2016/01/22 19:52:02 
Transferred:            0 Bytes (   0.00 kByte/s)

2016/01/22 19:54:02
FWIW, I'm running rclone v1.26 AMD64 on Amazon Linux AMI 2015.09.

Still stumped by the original issue.  The file does exist.  I can use AWS CLI tools to download it.  Is it possible that it's an issue with the filename?  An encoding issue or something?

`119P_9183_Plasite+4550-ProductFlyer-0515.pdf: Failed to update remote mtime: NoSuchKey: The specified key does not exist.
    status code: 404, request id:`

So what that error means is that rclone went to set the modification time on the file, but s3 said it didn't exist which is strange indeed.

The `Unsolicited response received on idle HTTP channel starting with "H"` is strange also.

Both of those things make me wonder about your environment - I haven't seen either of those problems before.

Are you using the pre-compiled binary or did you compile it yourself?  If you compiled it yourself, can you try the pre-compiled binary?

Is it going through some sort of HTTP proxy?

Can you try the transfer on a machine which isn't within EC2?

It might be an eventual consistency thing.  If you retry the sync does it work afterwards?  Or is that file always a problem?

I tried a test with a file of that name on s3 and that didn't seem to be the problem. rclone could set the modification time just fine.

Does `rclone ls` list the file properly?  If so can you send me a snip from the listing?

Thanks a lot for responding...

I'm running the pre-compiled binary on EC2.  I'll give it a try on my OS X dev machine.

Here's the output from `rclone ls` which shows the file exists:

> rclone ls S3:<remote-file-path>/119P_9183_Plasite+4550-ProductFlyer-0515.pdf
>   679524 119P_9183_Plasite+4550-ProductFlyer-0515.pdf
> 
> Transferred:            0 Bytes (   0.00 kByte/s)
> Errors:                 0
> Checks:                 0
> Transferred:            0
> Elapsed time:           0

I may be on to something... Ran a copy of a single file with verbose output. Seems the file content is the same, but the mod time changed. Essentially, the file was overwritten it seems. I believe rclone is attempting to update the mod time, but not uploading the object since it didn't change. The AWS docs indicate that metadata can only be set at the time of uploading the object and not after. Does this sound right? Although, if this is the case, the error message is a bit misleading since the file is there. 

rclone -v copy Cloudfiles:<remote-file-path>/119P_9183_Plasite+4550-ProductFlyer-0515.pdf S3:<remote-file-path>/119P_9183_Plasite+4550-ProductFlyer-0515.pdf

Errors:                 0
Checks:                 2
Transferred:            0
Elapsed time:        2.2s
2016/01/26 13:17:25 Go routines at exit 19
Hmm, not sure about my theory above.  Performed more of a manual test and it all seemed to work ok.

Additional testing reveals that the presence of a '+' in the filename causes the issue.  Tested multiple times updating files with and without a '+' and updates with '+' in the filename failed to update modified time.

You can set the meta data after the object has been uploaded  using a COPY. 

It seems plausible that the + is causing the problem, but I can't replicate the problem. 

Did you try from your osx machine? 

Can you write a shell script that reproduces the problem? 

Eg

```
mkdir /tmp/test
echo 'hello' > /tmp/test/file-with+44.pdf
rclone sync /tmp/test s3:mytest49
touch /tmp/test/file*
rclone sync /tmp/test s3:mytest49 
```

Something like that should reproduce the problem - but I couldn't make it. 

It might be to do with the path of the file too. 

Does your bucket name really have < > in? That could be the problem.

I was able to reproduce the problem with the script you suggested. Regarding the bucket name, I just used a placeholder as to not expose details publicly. 

./s3-test.sh
mkdir: /tmp/test: File exists
2016/01/27 09:19:00 S3 bucket <bucket-name> path test/mytest49/: Building file list

Elapsed time:        3.1s

I feel stupid now, because I just ran the script I sent you and it reproduces the problem for me now just fine! ``` 2016/01/27 17:06:43 HTTP REQUEST 2016/01/27 17:06:43 PUT http://s3.amazonaws.com/mytest50/file-with%2B44.pdf HTTP/1.1 Host: s3.amazonaws.com User-Agent: rclone/v1.26 Content-Length: 0 Authorization: AWS4-HMAC-SHA256 Credenti[snip] Content-Type: application/pdf X-Amz-Acl: X-Amz-Content-Sha256: e3b0c44298fc1c149afbf4c8996fb92427ae41e4649b934ca495991b7852b855 X-Amz-Copy-Source: mytest50/file-with+44.pdf X-Amz-Date: 20160127T170643Z X-Amz-Meta-Mtime: 1453914402.34825253 X-Amz-Metadata-Directive: REPLACE Accept-Encoding: gzip ``` ``` 2016/01/27 17:06:43 HTTP RESPONSE 2016/01/27 17:06:43 HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found Transfer-Encoding: chunked Content-Type: application/xml Date: Wed, 27 Jan 2016 17:06:42 GMT Server: AmazonS3 X-Amz-Id-2: 55baDyXyzc+SSEIWHVJ+yvSo+BW1Lr8yOdTg5nRuleC59dodpeWJAbSMFytup75eYps/6j3u4T8= X-Amz-Request-Id: 56F1855EE2332F05 f8 NoSuchKeyThe specified key does not exist.file-with 44.pdf56F1855EE2332F0555baDyXyzc+SSEIWHVJ+yvSo+BW1Lr8yOdTg5nRuleC59dodpeWJAbSMFytup75eYps/6j3u4T8= 0 ``` Which makes the problem blindingly obvious - `file-with 44.pdf` is a give away. I've fixed this and uploaded a beta for you to try http://pub.rclone.org/v1.26-48-gcae19df%CE%B2/ If it doesn't fix it for you then please re-open the ticket!
Thanks for implementing a fix so quickly!  Much appreciated.  I'll give it a try.
Hmm, this new version seems to be resulting in out of memory errors.
Once transfers start memory should be stable. Can you see if it goes up while transfers are in progress? Maybe there is a memory leak. It is probably unrelated to this issue though.
Seems to be happening prior to any transfers starting.

issue.title: s3: dreamhost: server side copy of non ascii characters fails

milestone.title: Known Problem
milestone.description: This milestone contains issues which are known problems which are proving difficult to fix, or are awaiting an external fix or we haven't got round to yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
From osx terminal, when I sync one bucket to another bucket (server side), I can see that files with simples characters and no spaces, are copied ok, 
files with complex characters and spaces between files, results in errors like these:

2016/07/15 11:16:14 06 - When My 'a.odf: Failed to copy: NoSuchKey: 
    status code: 404, request id: tx00000000000000000dee2-005788f02e-e20c70e-default

When filing an issue, please include the following information if
possible as well as a description of the problem.

> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone v1.29

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

OSX El Cap.

> Locale:

LANG=
LC_COLLATE="C"
LC_CTYPE="UTF-8"
LC_MESSAGES="C"
LC_MONETARY="C"
LC_NUMERIC="C"
LC_TIME="C"
LC_ALL=

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

DreamObjects

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

copy and sync

body:
Hi i am using minio 3.0.6 . its working fine for upload file in java .But it give me a error while i am trying to download a file

error occured
ErrorResponse(code=NoSuchKey, message=The specified key does not exist., bucketName=null, objectName=null, resource=/resourse-server/284/health/1509086845373.doc, requestId=3L137, hostId=3L137)
request={method=GET, url=http://host:port/bucketName/284/health/1509086845373.doc, headers=Range: bytes=0-
Host: hostname:portnumber
User-Agent: Minio (amd64; amd64) minio-java/dev
x-amz-content-sha256: e3b0c44298fc1c149afbf4c8996fb92427ae41e4649b934ca495991b7852b855
x-amz-date: 20171028T063134Z
Authorization: AWS4-HMAC-SHA256 Credential=REDACTED/20171028/us-east-1/s3/aws4_request, SignedHeaders=host;range;x-amz-content-sha256;x-amz-date, Signature=REDACTED
}
response={code=404, headers=Accept-Ranges: bytes
Content-Type: application/xml
Server: Minio/RELEASE.2017-07-24T18-27-35Z (linux; amd64)
Vary: Origin
X-Amz-Request-Id: 14F1A834C5D82B02
Date: Sat, 28 Oct 2017 06:31:34 GMT
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
}
please help me

This issue exists for me under rclone v1.39.

I checked the source code and the newer version uses [a different method](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/lib/rest/url.go) to escape path.

From [the document](https://golang.org/pkg/net/url/) of golang I saw this:
> PathUnescape is identical to QueryUnescape except that it does not unescape '+' to ' ' (space).

This sounds like exactly the reason that this issue reappear with filename including '+'.

@mudkipme can you please make a [new issue on github](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/new) about this and fill in the info there like which cloud provider, what command you were using and a log - thanks!

issue.title: "Failed to set modification time: NoSuchKey: The specified key does not exist" with S3

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
I can reproduce #315 with rclone v1.39 with Amazon S3 and filenames containing `+` character.

Guess this has something to do with the difference between `PathEscape` and `QueryEscape`.

> What is your rclone version

rclone v1.39

> Which OS you are using and how many bits

Arch Linux (Linux 4.14.12-x86_64)

> Which cloud storage system are you using?

Amazon S3

> The command you were trying to run

```bash
mkdir /tmp/test
echo 'hello' > /tmp/test/file-with+44.pdf
rclone sync /tmp/test s3:52poke/test
touch /tmp/test/file*
rclone sync /tmp/test s3:52poke/test
```

> A log from the command with the `-vv` flag

```
2018/01/23 02:40:43 DEBUG : Using config file from "/root/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
```
